review: Honestly this device is capable of a whole lot more, but for now it has been worth the $35 just for youtube.You can control the volume, play, and pause straight from yours phone.  Also, answering phone calls or going into other apps does not disrupt the video stream.  You can even go back into youtube and assemble a playlist of what to show once the current video ends.  Chromecast has made it incredibly simply to come home after a hard day of work, plop down on the couch, and pull up a playlist of Game Grumps, DBZ the Abridged Series, and Tech News.  This convenience of never having to try to use the TV remote's number pad to painstakingly type out a search query would have justified the cost as is!  The fact that I can also watch netflix, access my Google Play Movies, stream tabs from my computer, and listen to Music through this is just icing on the cake.  There are plenty of other apps incoming so this device will only gain value with time.I highly recommend purchasing a Chromecast if you use Chrome, Youtube, or Netflix regularly!
